Source: World Health Organization, Global Database on Child Growth and Malnutrition. Country-level data are unadjusted data from national surveys, and thus may not be comparable across countries.

Indicator Name: Prevalence of underweight, weight for age (% of children under 5)
Long definition: Prevalence of underweight children is the percentage of children under age 5 whose weight for age is more than two standard deviations below the median for the international reference population ages 0-59 months. The data are based on the WHO's new child growth standards released in 2006.
Source: World Health Organization, Global Database on Child Growth and Malnutrition. Country-level data are unadjusted data from national surveys, and thus may not be comparable across countries. Adjusted, comparable data are available at http://www.who.int/nutgrowthdb/en. Aggregation is based on UNICEF, WHO, and the World Bank harmonized dataset (adjusted, comparable data) and methodology.

Indicator Name: Prevalence of underweight, weight for age, female (% of children under 5)
Long definition: Prevalence of underweight children is the percentage of children under age 5 whose weight for age is more than two standard deviations below the median for the international reference population ages 0-59 months. The data are based on the WHO's new child growth standards released in 2006.
Source: World Health Organization, Global Database on Child Growth and Malnutrition. Country-level data are unadjusted data from national surveys, and thus may not be comparable across countries.

Indicator Name: Prevalence of underweight, weight for age, male (% of children under 5)
Long definition: Prevalence of underweight children is the percentage of children under age 5 whose weight for age is more than two standard deviations below the median for the international reference population ages 0-59 months. The data are based on the WHO's new child growth standards released in 2006.
Source: World Health Organization, Global Database on Child Growth and Malnutrition. Country-level data are unadjusted data from national surveys, and thus may not be comparable across countries.

Indicator Name: Prevalence of wasting, weight for height (% of children under 5)
Long definition: Wasting prevalence is the proportion of children under five whose weight for height is more than two standard deviations below the median for the international reference population ages 0-59.
Source: World Health Organization, Global Database on Child Growth and Malnutrition. Country-level data are unadjusted data from national surveys, and thus may not be comparable across countries. Adjusted, comparable data are available at http://www.who.int/nutgrowthdb/en. Aggregation is based on UNICEF, WHO, and the World Bank harmonized dataset (adjusted, comparable data) and methodology.

Indicator Name: Prevalence of wasting, weight for height, female (% of children under 5)
Long definition: Wasting prevalence is the proportion of children under five whose weight for height is more than two standard deviations below the median for the international reference population ages 0-59.
Source: World Health Organization, Global Database on Child Growth and Malnutrition. Country-level data are unadjusted data from national surveys, and thus may not be comparable across countries.

Indicator Name: Prevalence of wasting, weight for height, male (% of children under 5)
Long definition: Wasting prevalence is the proportion of children under five whose weight for height is more than two standard deviations below the median for the international reference population ages 0-59.
Source: World Health Organization, Global Database on Child Growth and Malnutrition. Country-level data are unadjusted data from national surveys, and thus may not be comparable across countries.

Indicator Name: Primary completion rate, female (% of relevant age group)
Long definition: Primary completion rate, or gross intake ratio to the last grade of primary education, is the number of new entrants (enrollments minus repeaters) in the last grade of primary education, regardless of age, divided by the population at the entrance age for the last grade of primary education. Data limitations preclude adjusting for students who drop out during the final year of primary education.
Source: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.

Indicator Name: Primary completion rate, male (% of relevant age group)
Long definition: Primary completion rate, or gross intake ratio to the last grade of primary education, is the number of new entrants (enrollments minus repeaters) in the last grade of primary education, regardless of age, divided by the population at the entrance age for the last grade of primary education. Data limitations preclude adjusting for students who drop out during the final year of primary education.
Source: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.

Indicator Name: Primary education, pupils (% female)
Long definition: Female pupils as a percentage of total pupils at primary level include enrollments in public and private schools.
Source: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.

Indicator Name: Primary education, teachers (% female)
Long definition: Female teachers as a percentage of total primary education teachers includes full-time and part-time teachers.
Source: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.

Indicator Name: Progression to secondary school, female (%)
Long definition: Progression to secondary school refers to the number of new entrants to the first grade of secondary school in a given year as a percentage of the number of students enrolled in the final grade of primary school in the previous year (minus the number of repeaters from the last grade of primary education in the given year).
Source: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.

Indicator Name: Progression to secondary school, male (%)
Long definition: Progression to secondary school refers to the number of new entrants to the first grade of secondary school in a given year as a percentage of the number of students enrolled in the final grade of primary school in the previous year (minus the number of repeaters from the last grade of primary education in the given year).
Source: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.

Indicator Name: Proportion of seats held by women in national parliaments (%)
Long definition: Women in parliaments are the percentage of parliamentary seats in a single or lower chamber held by women.
Source: Inter-Parliamentary Union (IPU) (www.ipu.org).

Indicator Name: Proportion of women in ministerial level positions (%)
Long definition: Women in ministerial level positions is the proportion of women in ministerial or equivalent positions (including deputy prime ministers) in the government. Prime Ministers/Heads of Government are included when they hold ministerial portfolios. Vice-Presidents and heads of governmental or public agencies are excluded.
Source: Inter-Parliamentary Union (IPU). Women in Politics.

Indicator Name: Government expenditure on education, total (% of GDP)
Long definition: General government expenditure on education (current, capital, and transfers) is expressed as a percentage of GDP. It includes expenditure funded by transfers from international sources to government. General government usually refers to local, regional and central governments.
Source: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.

Indicator Name: Ratio of female to male labor force participation rate (%) (modeled ILO estimate)
Long definition: Labor force participation rate is the proportion of the population ages 15 and older that is economically active: all people who supply labor for the production of goods and services during a specified period.
Source: International Labour Organization, Key Indicators of the Labour Market database.

Indicator Name: Ratio of female to male labor force participation rate (%) (national estimate)
Long definition: Labor force participation rate is the proportion of the population ages 15 and older that is economically active: all people who supply labor for the production of goods and services during a specified period.
Source: International Labour Organization, Key Indicators of the Labour Market database.

Indicator Name: Ratio of female to male youth unemployment rate (% ages 15-24) (modeled ILO estimate)
Long definition: Ratio of female to male youth unemployment is the percentage of female to male youth unemployment rates.
Source: International Labour Organization, Key Indicators of the Labour Market database.

Indicator Name: Ratio of female to male youth unemployment rate (% ages 15-24) (national estimate)
Long definition: Ratio of female to male youth unemployment is the percentage of female to male youth unemployment rates.
Source: International Labour Organization, Key Indicators of the Labour Market database.

Indicator Name: Received domestic remittances in the past year, female (% age 15+) [w2]
Long definition: Denotes the percentage of respondents who report personally receiving any money in the past 12 months from a relative or friend living in a different area of their country. This includes any money received in person (female, % age 15+). [w2: data are available for wave 2].
Source: Demirguc-Kunt et al., 2015

Indicator Name: Received domestic remittances in the past year, male (% age 15+) [w2]
Long definition: Denotes the percentage of respondents who report personally receiving any money in the past 12 months from a relative or friend living in a different area of their country. This includes any money received in person (male, % age 15+). [w2: data are available for wave 2].
Source: Demirguc-Kunt et al., 2015

Indicator Name: Received government transfers in the past year, female (% age 15+) [w2]
Long definition: Denotes the percentage of respondents who report personally receiving any financial support from the government in the past 12 months. This includes payments for educational or medical expenses, unemployment benefits, subsidy payments, or any kind of social benefits. It does not include wages or any payments related to work (female, % age 15+). [w2: data are available for wave 2].
Source: Demirguc-Kunt et al., 2015

Indicator Name: Received government transfers in the past year, male (% age 15+) [w2]
Long definition: Denotes the percentage of respondents who report personally receiving any financial support from the government in the past 12 months. This includes payments for educational or medical expenses, unemployment benefits, subsidy payments, or any kind of social benefits. It does not include wages or any payments related to work (male, % age 15+). [w2: data are available for wave 2].
Source: Demirguc-Kunt et al., 2015

Indicator Name: Received payments for agricultural products in the past year, female (% age 15+) [w2]
Long definition: Denotes the percentage of respondents who report personally receiving money from any source for the sale of agricultural products, crops, produce, or livestock (self- or family-owned) in the past 12 months (female, % age 15+). [w2: data are available for wave 2].
Source: Demirguc-Kunt et al., 2015

Indicator Name: Received payments for agricultural products in the past year, male (% age 15+) [w2]
Long definition: Denotes the percentage of respondents who report personally receiving money from any source for the sale of agricultural products, crops, produce, or livestock (self- or family-owned) in the past 12 months (male, % age 15+). [w2: data are available for wave 2].
Source: Demirguc-Kunt et al., 2015

Indicator Name: Received wages in the past year, female (% age 15+) [w2]
Long definition: Denotes the percentage of respondents who report receiving any money from an employer in the past 12 months in the form of a salary or wages for doing work. This does not include any money received directly from clients or customers (female, % age 15+). [w2: data are available for wave 2].
Source: Demirguc-Kunt et al., 2015

Indicator Name: Received wages in the past year, male (% age 15+) [w2]
Long definition: Denotes the percentage of respondents who report receiving any money from an employer in the past 12 months in the form of a salary or wages for doing work. This does not include any money received directly from clients or customers (male, % age 15+). [w2: data are available for wave 2].
Source: Demirguc-Kunt et al., 2015

Indicator Name: Rural population, female (% of total)
Long definition: Female rural population is the percentage of females who live in rural areas to total population.
Source: The United Nations Population Division's World Urbanization Prospects.

Indicator Name: Rural population, male (% of total)
Long definition: Male rural population is the percentage males who live in rural areas to total population.
Source: The United Nations Population Division's World Urbanization Prospects.

Indicator Name: Saved any money in the past year, female (% age 15+) [w1]
Long definition: Denotes the percentage of respondents who report saving or setting aside any money in the past 12 months (female, % age 15+). [w1: data are available for wave 1].
Source: Demirguc-Kunt and Klapper, 2012

Indicator Name: Saved any money in the past year, female (% age 15+) [w2]
Long definition: Denotes the percentage of respondents who report personally saving or setting aside any money for any reason and using any mode of saving in the past 12 months (female, % age 15+). [w2: data are available for wave 2].
Source: Demirguc-Kunt et al., 2015

Indicator Name: Saved any money in the past year, male (% age 15+) [w1]
Long definition: Denotes the percentage of respondents who report saving or setting aside any money in the past 12 months (male, % age 15+). [w1: data are available for wave 1].
Source: Demirguc-Kunt and Klapper, 2012

Indicator Name: Saved any money in the past year, male (% age 15+) [w2]
Long definition: Denotes the percentage of respondents who report personally saving or setting aside any money for any reason and using any mode of saving in the past 12 months (male, % age 15+). [w2: data are available for wave 2].
Source: Demirguc-Kunt et al., 2015

Indicator Name: Saved at a financial institution, female (% age 15+) [ts]
Long definition: Denotes the percentage of respondents who report saving or setting aside any money at a bank or another type of financial institution in the past 12 months (see year-specific definitions for details) (female, % age 15+). [ts: data are available for multiple waves].
Source: Demirguc-Kunt et al., 2015

Indicator Name: Saved at a financial institution, male (% age 15+) [ts]
Long definition: Denotes the percentage of respondents who report saving or setting aside any money at a bank or another type of financial institution in the past 12 months (see year-specific definitions for details) (male, % age 15+). [ts: data are available for multiple waves].
Source: Demirguc-Kunt et al., 2015

Indicator Name: Saved for education or school fees, female (% age 15+) [w2]
Long definition: Denotes the percentage of respondents who report saving or setting aside any money in the past 12 months for education or school fees (female, % age 15+). [w2: data are available for wave 2].
Source: Demirguc-Kunt et al., 2015

Indicator Name: Saved for education or school fees, male (% age 15+) [w2]
Long definition: Denotes the percentage of respondents who report saving or setting aside any money in the past 12 months for education or school fees (male, % age 15+). [w2: data are available for wave 2].
Source: Demirguc-Kunt et al., 2015

Indicator Name: Saved for emergencies, female (% age 15+) [w1]
Long definition: Denotes the percentage of respondents who report having saved for emergencies or a time when they expect to have less income in the past 12 months (female, % age 15+). [w1: data are available for wave 1].
Source: Demirguc-Kunt and Klapper, 2012

Indicator Name: Saved for emergencies, male (% age 15+) [w1]
Long definition: Denotes the percentage of respondents who report having saved for emergencies or a time when they expect to have less income in the past 12 months (male, % age 15+). [w1: data are available for wave 1].
Source: Demirguc-Kunt and Klapper, 2012

Indicator Name: Saved for future expenses, female (% age 15+) [w1]
Long definition: Denotes the percentage of respondents who report saving for expenses in the future such as education, a wedding, or a big purchase in the past 12 months (female, % age 15+). [w1: data are available for wave 1].
Source: Demirguc-Kunt and Klapper, 2012

Indicator Name: Saved for future expenses, male (% age 15+) [w1]
Long definition: Denotes the percentage of respondents who report saving for expenses in the future such as education, a wedding, or a big purchase in the past 12 months (male, % age 15+). [w1: data are available for wave 1].
Source: Demirguc-Kunt and Klapper, 2012

Indicator Name: Saved for old age, female (% age 15+) [w2]
Long definition: Denotes the percentage of respondents who report saving or setting aside any money in the past 12 months for old age (female, % age 15+). [w2: data are available for wave 2].
Source: Demirguc-Kunt et al., 2015

Indicator Name: Saved for old age, male (% age 15+) [w2]
Long definition: Denotes the percentage of respondents who report saving or setting aside any money in the past 12 months for old age (male, % age 15+). [w2: data are available for wave 2].
Source: Demirguc-Kunt et al., 2015

Indicator Name: Saved to start, operate, or expand a farm or business, female (% age 15+) [w2]
Long definition: Denotes the percentage of respondents who report saving or setting aside any money in the past 12 months to start, operate, or expand a farm or business (female, % age 15+). [w2: data are available for wave 2].
Source: Demirguc-Kunt et al., 2015

Indicator Name: Saved to start, operate, or expand a farm or business, male (% age 15+) [w2]
Long definition: Denotes the percentage of respondents who report saving or setting aside any money in the past 12 months to start, operate, or expand a farm or business (male, % age 15+). [w2: data are available for wave 2].
Source: Demirguc-Kunt et al., 2015

Indicator Name: Saved using a savings club or a person outside the family, female (% age 15+) [ts]
Long definition: Denotes the percentage of respondents who report saving or setting aside any money using a savings club or a person outside the family in the past 12 months (see year-specific definitions for details) (female, % age 15+). [ts: data are available for multiple waves].
Source: Demirguc-Kunt et al., 2015

Indicator Name: Saved using a savings club or a person outside the family, male (% age 15+) [ts]
Long definition: Denotes the percentage of respondents who report saving or setting aside any money using a savings club or a person outside the family in the past 12 months (see year-specific definitions for details) (male, % age 15+). [ts: data are available for multiple waves].
Source: Demirguc-Kunt et al., 2015

Indicator Name: School enrollment, primary (gross), gender parity index (GPI)
Long definition: Gender parity index for gross enrollment ratio in primary education is the ratio of girls to boys enrolled at primary level in public and private schools.
Source: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.

Indicator Name: School enrollment, primary and secondary (gross), gender parity index (GPI)
Long definition: Gender parity index for gross enrollment ratio in primary and secondary education is the ratio of girls to boys enrolled at primary and secondary levels in public and private schools.
Source: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.

Indicator Name: School enrollment, primary, female (% gross)
Long definition: Gross enrollment ratio is the ratio of total enrollment, regardless of age, to the population of the age group that officially corresponds to the level of education shown. Primary education provides children with basic reading, writing, and mathematics skills along with an elementary understanding of such subjects as history, geography, natural science, social science, art, and music.
Source: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.

Indicator Name: School enrollment, primary, female (% net)
Long definition: Net enrollment rate is the ratio of children of official school age who are enrolled in school to the population of the corresponding official school age. Primary education provides children with basic reading, writing, and mathematics skills along with an elementary understanding of such subjects as history, geography, natural science, social science, art, and music.
Source: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.

Indicator Name: School enrollment, primary, male (% gross)
Long definition: Gross enrollment ratio is the ratio of total enrollment, regardless of age, to the population of the age group that officially corresponds to the level of education shown. Primary education provides children with basic reading, writing, and mathematics skills along with an elementary understanding of such subjects as history, geography, natural science, social science, art, and music.
Source: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.

Indicator Name: School enrollment, primary, male (% net)
Long definition: Net enrollment rate is the ratio of children of official school age who are enrolled in school to the population of the corresponding official school age. Primary education provides children with basic reading, writing, and mathematics skills along with an elementary understanding of such subjects as history, geography, natural science, social science, art, and music.
Source: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.

Indicator Name: School enrollment, secondary (gross), gender parity index (GPI)
